intro: Osteospermum amplectens, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and purple or pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Osteospermum amplectens is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
